courseDescription:
This course focuses on the significant advantages of practising mindfulness and meditation in our daily lives. Meditation is now becoming increasingly popular and widely accepted in medical centres around the world. Many meditation and mindfulness techniques have proven effective when treating mental conditions. These techniques may help patients obtain longer-lasting results, and by using a self-awareness tool relapsing into bad habits can be prevented.

In today’s world, our mind is continuously flooded with stressful situations in the workplace or at home. Mindful techniques mentioned in this course will teach you how to have an improved sense of control over your reactions when faced with challenging circumstances. Mindfulness, when applied in the workspace or with children, results in developing excellent listening skills, having innovative solutions to problems and improving relationships with ourselves as well as with others.

Emotions have a direct impact on our decisions, reactions and our eating habits. Emotional or mental issues may cause some eating disorders. Developing mindful eating routines and staying grounded to the present moment may help to establish a positive relationship with food. Those who become mindfully aware of their situation may start to make positive life choices that support their recovery from an eating disorder.

Meditation and mindfulness can be practised by anyone, from all walks of life. This course will also discredit some myths and misinformation about meditation. You will learn easy step-by-step mindful exercises, practices and techniques that can be performed anywhere, anytime. Cultivating a mindful mindset may not be easy, but if it’s applied correctly, the benefits are well worth the effort.
